data.title: Weak service
data.text: Went here for dinner. The service started out as being unfriendly, and then it morphed in to being slow, taking a while to bring me my check and then to collect it. Needless to say this was quite disappointing. The food was pretty good. However, their drinks are way over priced for a place like this, particularly the wine. Not so good. They also close very early at night.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: Enjoy going with friends  and sitting on the patio enjoying a nice glass of wine or beer and having pizza on a Friday night in the summer looking out at the river walk which is very nice.

data.title: Gone Downhill
data.text: This used to be our favorite downtown restaurant.  The backyard patio is an amazing place to sit and eat a meal, especially later in the evening when the sun is going down and the lights come on over the river.  But since the last time we were there, most of the best food have been taken off the menu.  There are no longer any pasta dishes or paninis.  All that is left on the menu are a few sandwiches and some pizza.  We ordered the pan pizza and had to send it back because it was still doughy inside.  It was flavorless and the toppings were sparse.  They have a good beer selection, but that night we were in the mood for wine.  It was served way too warm for a red wine.  I'm hoping that if enough people complain a bit, things will get better again.

data.title: Nice location and set up, but average food at best.
data.text:
Really nice set up inside and out, back patio facing the river is very cool.
Bad experience with server having very little knowledge about the food and drink, and the food being sub par, leads me to this average at best rating.

data.title: Good food, nice atmosphere
data.text: Very good food, pizza is our favorite in the area. Nice atmosphere, and they have a beautiful deck area overlooking the river.

data.title: Good food for a casual meal
data.text: I have been to Chooch's a few times and it seems they are constantly improving! My first experience was just okay- our appetizer wasn't brought out until we asked about it after receiving our food but the food WAS good and our server was friendly and funny. We really enjoyed sitting outside on the patio even when it began to rain. The next time I went the gourmet burger was good and cheap as well and the service was just fine. This is a great place for a casual meal of pizza or a burger in a laid back atmosphere. Try eating out on the patio!

data.title: Delightful downtown Elgin pizza
data.text: My wife and I have been to Chooch's twice and we will keep coming back. The pizza is one of the best in the area. At our last visit we saw a burger on the menu made with bacon mixed in the ground beef and more bacon served on top, I'm looking forward to trying this on our next visit. The service at Chooch's was great, friendly staff and owner. I noticed the owner walk with a waitress out to her car both times we were there at the end of her day and he stopped by our table to see if we were enjoying our meal. To me that says he cares about his employees and customers and the food that is being served. Please give Chooch's a try, It's nice to see downtown Elgin coming back and we need to give support to our local businesses

data.title: Good downtown location for pizza & sandwiches
data.text: Good choice for pizza,has a sandwich menu and drinks..Have enjoyed several visits. Good value. Service has sometimes been slow. Offers outside dining with river view. The place does need larger washrooms.

data.title: Good Times- Great atmosphere
data.text: A little cramped at times, but a great restaurant.  Good drinks and quick appetizer service.  Food was good and service was great.

data.title: Great local pizza
data.text: Stopped in here and was pleasantly surprised that the pizza was terrific. We also had the pizza doughnuts and the spinach and feta pizza. Everything was great all around. The crust is what makes pizza. Chooch's is top notch.

data.title: Great Outdoor Location!
data.text: If your looking for some good pizza and to be outdoors, try Chooch's! The outdoor seating and the view of the river is perfect. Food is good too! When you're done stroll along the river and downtown and burn off some of those calories. Little by little downtown Elgin is coming together.

data.title: Our favorite pizza in Elgin
data.text: We had been hoping to find better pizza and we found it here. It is now our go-to place for pizza. Love the crust, sauce and toppings - especially pepperoni.  Now that the outside dining area is open, dining at Chooch's is even more pleasant.

data.title: river-walk gem
data.text: What a fun spot! Great patio view of the Fox River , lovely old building inside and out- good pizza, very friendly service, and we could hear the performer at the nearby Festival Park- great way to unwind and kick off the week-end!

data.title: Good food in a great environment
data.text: This restaurant is right in the heart of Elgin's historic downtown.  The building is one of the old ones, and is very interesting. And now they've added a back courtyard that opens onto the riverwalk. It was really nice to sit out there at the end of last summer.  Food is good, particularly the sandwiches, which are an excellent value.  And who cares about the waistline--go for the deep-fried Tater Tots.  :-)

data.title: A fun place for some great pizza
data.text: The owners here have done a great job of remodeling a fine old downtown building...a roomy main floor combines with another area on the 2nd floor that can accommodate diners and also special parties and meetings. New this past year is the addition of a really nice outside bar and deck where you can eat and drink while enjoying the outdoors and watching activity along the Fox River. Great pizza (my favorite is the BBQ pizza), good sandwiches, pasta and salads, with many specials throughout the week. I would give Chooch's a big thumbs up!!

data.title: Good pizza;  Nice & cozy atmosphere.
data.text:
We stopped during the week around 7:30;  not crowded. Warm & cozy setting and music not too loud so we could actually talk during our dinner.   Pizza was good; boyfriend loved the generaous mozarella on it.   He said the beer was ok but kind of pricey.  

Overall, we'd love to go more often but it is pricier than the other pizza places we go.  I just read they have half price pizza in Feb on certain week nights so we'll go back soon for that.

data.title: Good food and service plus a nice view
data.text:
It's nice to have more places in Elgin especially in the downtown area.  We like to go here as a stop on a bike ride or just stop by for lunch (and occasionally dinner).  The inside has character and the outside opens up to the newly finished river walk and bike trail.  It's a great place to relax on a nice day or evening.

Some people I've been with like the pizza and others are not too excited about it.  What stands out to me on the menu is the focaccia bread sandwiches.  They make the bread themselves and have some very good sandwich choices to go on the bread.  I recommend trying these - we sometimes will order a couple and then share to try some of the different choices.

Service has always been good for us and the owners are always there.  They also have some good specials and decent beer selection.

data.title: I would have rated this a 3, but....
data.text:
To be fair, I have only been at this establishment 4 times. They have usually been fine. The last time I came in I was with some friends. Everything started ok, but the waitress was a smart-alec and thought she was being cute by trying to get into an argument with us over some recommendations to enhance the establishment.
Then she got the drinks wrong.... then when he went in to get his change, she gave him the wrong change! She was actually going to tip herself almost 40%!
On our way out the owner asked if we enjoyed and I told him that we were not happy.. I felt that he could have asked what had happened so that he could review the situation so that it doesn't happen again. My friends and I have disposable income and make it a point to spend in the Elgin, IL business area, but Chooch's may have lost my loyality and will look for other new places that are opening up, like Abe Froman's or go to Elgin Public House,or Toom Toom.

data.title: great place great pizza
data.text:
Wonderful experience. First visit. Sausage & green pepper. Ate outside. Nice and clean. It was a pleasure to find an adult place to have a quiet meal without a pack of screaming kids for a change.
Will be a regular now!

data.title: Nice place, No kids menu
data.text: The restaurant was nice. The out door eating area was really nice. You get a nice view of Elgin's river walk area. I didn't feel like it was a great place to take the kids.  There is no kids menu. I realize they can eat cheese pizza, but if they don't like that you are out of luck.  There isn't anything for young children to do.  My kids are 3&5 and it took a while to get 2 pizzas. It was a little difficult to keep the kiddos happy.
